page.title: 01Introduction to Yarlet Area
page.content: This is a region consisting of gently undulating farmland, which is mostly pasture, through half of the western side is arable, growing such crops as potatoes, rape, barley and wheat. There are few woods, but the hedges, which surround each field, have several trees in them. There are two small villages, Whitgreave and Great Bridheford both commutor villages for Stone and Stafford. Yarlet and marston are scattered communities of small farms and private homes. Perhaps half the buildings have been put up in this century. Running from north to south is the M6 motorway and the A34 Trunk road, both of which carry heavy traffic. There are several lans which connect the farms and villages. In the south-west corner the Stone-Safford railway can be seen.
